case.title: Rosmah Solar Project Corruption Trial
case.subtitle: Former First Lady Convicted of Bribery
case.description: Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor, wife of former Prime Minister Najib Razak, was charged with soliciting and receiving bribes totaling RM6.5 million in connection with a RM1.25 billion solar energy project for rural schools in Sarawak. The project was awarded to Jepak Holdings Sdn Bhd. Rosmah faced 3 charges: 1 count of soliciting RM187.5 million and 2 counts of receiving RM6.5 million in bribes between 2016 and 2017. The case highlighted corruption in government procurement involving education projects for underserved communities.
case.verdictSummary: Rosmah Mansor was found guilty on all 3 charges. She was sentenced to 10 years imprisonment on each charge (to run concurrently) and fined RM970 million (in default, an additional 23 years imprisonment). She is currently appealing the conviction.
case.metaDescription: Complete coverage of Rosmah Mansor's solar project corruption trial. Former First Lady convicted of RM6.5 million bribery. Timeline, verdict, and appeal status.

timeline.title: MACC Questioning
timeline.description: Rosmah Mansor was called in for questioning by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) regarding the solar hybrid project in Sarawak.

timeline.title: Charged with 17 Counts of Money Laundering
timeline.description: Rosmah was initially charged with 17 counts of money laundering involving RM7.1 million. These charges were later amended.

timeline.title: Bribery Charges Filed
timeline.description: Rosmah was charged with 3 counts of bribery: 1 count of soliciting RM187.5 million and 2 counts of receiving RM6.5 million as gratification for helping Jepak Holdings secure the solar project contract.

timeline.title: Trial Commences
timeline.description: The trial began at the Kuala Lumpur High Court before Justice Mohamed Zaini Mazlan. The prosecution outlined how the bribes were allegedly facilitated.

timeline.title: Jepak Holdings MD Testifies
timeline.description: Saidi Abang Samsudin, managing director of Jepak Holdings, testified about meetings with Rosmah and payments made through intermediaries.

timeline.title: Key Witness: Rizal Mansor
timeline.description: Rosmah's former aide Rizal Mansor testified about his role in facilitating meetings and payments between Jepak Holdings and Rosmah.

timeline.title: Prosecution Closes Case
timeline.description: The prosecution rested its case after calling 23 witnesses including contractors, former aides, and banking officials.

timeline.title: Prima Facie Case Established
timeline.description: Justice Zaini ruled that the prosecution established a prima facie case on all 3 charges. Rosmah was called to enter her defence.

timeline.title: Rosmah Takes the Stand
timeline.description: Rosmah testified in her own defence, denying any involvement in soliciting or receiving bribes. She claimed to be a victim of a conspiracy.

timeline.title: Verdict: Guilty on All 3 Charges
timeline.description: Justice Zaini found Rosmah guilty on all 3 counts. She was sentenced to 10 years imprisonment (concurrent) and fined RM970 million. Execution of sentence was stayed pending appeal.

timeline.title: Appeal Filed
timeline.description: Rosmah's defence team, led by Jagjit Singh, filed an appeal against the conviction and sentence at the Court of Appeal.

timeline.title: Appeal Hearing Begins
timeline.description: The Court of Appeal began hearing Rosmah's appeal. Her defence raised issues about the reliability of key witnesses and procedural matters.
